metadata.name: PowerShell Module File Created
metadata.comment: Detects the creation of a new PowerShell module ".psm1", ".psd1", ".dll", ".ps1", etc.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\\\pwsh.exe'))) AND (contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\\\windowspowershell\\\\modules\\\\')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\\\powershell\\\\7\\\\modules\\\\'))))

output.summary: Detects the creation of a new PowerShell module ".psm1", ".psd1", ".dll", ".ps1", etc.

metadata.objective: False positive: Likely References: Internal Research, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/developer/module/understanding-a-windows-powershell-module?view=powershell-7.3
